Quality control -> External QC: BioRad

Introduction

The Format field in the QC export screen allows to select Biorad. The Specifics button in the QC export screen allows to indicate if GLIMS should use the Biorad Unity of Flex format.

Note

Results of both quantitative and qualitative QC populations are exported. For qualitative QC populations, only the results of properties with the datatype Enumerated will be exported.

Export details for Unity format

Biorad field Syntax GLIMS field Used when
Level 1, 2 or 3 Last digit of QCLot.LotNumber QCLot.NumberHasBioradLevel = Yes and QCLot.LotNumber length = 5 and last digit of QCLotNumber = 1, 2 or 3
QCPopulation.Level Level could not be derived from QCLot.LotNumber
Lab 6 digits QCPopulation.BioradLabCode Always
Lot 5 digits,
ending with 0, 1, 2 or 3

QCLot.LotNumber

If QCLot.NumberHasBioradLevel = Yes and last digit of QCLotNumber = 1, 2 or 3, then last digit in exported LotNumber is replaced with 0

Station.BioradInstrumentCode AssessmentMethod.BioradInstrumentCode unknown
Station.Code Station.BioradInstrumentCode unknown
Reagent 4 digits Reagent.Code Export option "Use reagent code" is enabled.
ReagentLot.LotNumber Export option "Use reagent code" is disabled.
Unit 2 digits Unit.BioradCode Always
Temperature 1 digit AssessmentMethod.BioradTemperatureCode Always

Customizing the Flex format

The FLEX format is customizable in fields and fields order. GLIMS uses the following default format:

StationCode + "|" + AnalyteCode + "|" + LotCode + "|" + LevelCode + "|" + ResultDate (YYMMDD) + "|" + ResultTime (HHMM) + "|" + ResultValue + "|" + ReagentCode

However, you can customize the Flex record format in the QC population export Specifics screen.  Some fields can be enabled or disabled.  Each field can be changed in position.  The following fields are mandatory and cannot be disabled: Instrument, Analyte, Lot, Level, Date, Time and Result.

The Default button allows to restore the default GLIMS format.
